sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
   A -- B
  / \   |
C----D--E
    /   |
   F----G
```

What is the perfect matching for this graph?
message_2: A perfect matching is a set of edges that covers every vertex exactly once. In this graph, there is no perfect matching because there are an odd number of vertices (7). In a graph with an odd number of vertices, it is impossible to have a perfect matching, as each edge can only cover two vertices, and an odd number of vertices cannot be evenly divided by two.
